item.title: RIP Devo’s Bob Casale (Bob2)
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description: The founding Devo guitarist died from complications that lead to heart failure earlier this past week. He was 61. Devo had released its first record in 20 years back in 2010. Something for Everybody was a remarkably un-embarrassing foray back into Devo’s world of quirky synth-pop. Vice has unearthed an amazing photo archive of rare shots […]
item.content:encoded: The founding Devo guitarist died from complications that lead to heart failure earlier this past week. He was 61. Devo had released its first record in 20 years back in 2010. Something for Everybody was a remarkably un-embarrassing foray back into Devo’s world of quirky synth-pop. Vice has unearthed an amazing photo archive of rare shots from the band’s early Akron, Ohio days.

item.title: Legendary Folk Singer Pete Seeger Dies
item.dc:creator: pat
item.description: There are not words sufficient enough to commemorate the life of or incalculably lasting influence of Pete Seeger. Just listen to the man sing.
item.content:encoded: There are not words sufficient enough to commemorate the life of or incalculably lasting influence of Pete Seeger. Just listen to the man sing.

item.title: RIP: Devo Drummer, Alan Myers, Dies of Cancer
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description: DEVO – Booji Boy / “Jocko Homo” (SNL, October 14th 1978) from Isak Borg on Vimeo. Alan Myers, Devo’s “human metronome,” has died of cancer. Myers played with Devo for ten years from 1976 to 1986, leaving after the band’s Shout album over creative differences. Slicing Up Eyeballs has the details. Former Devo band mate […]
item.content:encoded:
DEVO – Booji Boy / “Jocko Homo” (SNL, October 14th 1978) from Isak Borg on Vimeo.

Alan Myers, Devo’s “human metronome,” has died of cancer. Myers played with Devo for ten years from 1976 to 1986, leaving after the band’s Shout album over creative differences. Slicing Up Eyeballs has the details. Former Devo band mate Gerald V. Casale has paid tribute on Twitter.

item.title: RIP Davy Jones
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description: Davy Jones, the lead singer of The Monkees died today of a heart attack in Florida. He was 66. I was 12 when MTV ran insane marathons of reruns of The Monkees’ TV show, which I watched obsessively. No matter who actually played which instruments on the albums, the Head soundtrack is classic.
item.content:encoded:
Davy Jones, the lead singer of The Monkees died today of a heart attack in Florida. He was 66.

I was 12 when MTV ran insane marathons of reruns of The Monkees’ TV show, which I watched obsessively. No matter who actually played which instruments on the albums, the Head soundtrack is classic.

item.title: R.I.P. Amy Winehouse
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description: Amy Winehouse was found dead in her apartment in London today. She was 27.
item.content:encoded: Amy Winehouse was found dead in her apartment in London today. She was 27.

item.title: RIP Poly Styrene
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description: From The Guardian: “Poly Styrene, best known as the frontwoman with 1970s punk group X-Ray Spex, has died. Styrene was receiving treatment for an advanced form of breast cancer when she passed away yesterday (Monday 25 April). She was 53.”
item.content:encoded:
From The Guardian:

“Poly Styrene, best known as the frontwoman with 1970s punk group X-Ray Spex, has died. Styrene was receiving treatment for an advanced form of breast cancer when she passed away yesterday (Monday 25 April). She was 53.”

item.title: The White Stripes Call It Quits
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description: The White Stripes’ official site has crashed from the curiosity, but a message was posted earlier announcing the duo’s demise. “The reason is not due to artistic differences or lack of wanting to continue, nor any health issues as both Meg and Jack are feeling fine and in good health,” the statement reads. “It is […]
item.content:encoded:
The White Stripes’ official site has crashed from the curiosity, but  a message was posted earlier announcing the duo’s demise.

“The reason is not due to artistic differences or lack of wanting to continue, nor any health issues as both Meg and Jack are feeling fine and in good health,” the statement reads. “It is for a myriad of reasons, but mostly to preserve what is beautiful and special about the band have it stay that way.”

“The White Stripes do not belong to Meg and Jack anymore. The White Stripes belong to you now and you can do with it whatever you want. The beauty of art and music is that it can last forever if people want it to. Thank you for sharing this experience. Your involvement will never be lost on any of us and we are truly grateful.”

[via Consequence of Sound]
